text: Marin Tudorache (born 1 April 1968) is a Romanian former footballer who played as a midfielder mainly for Jiul Petroșani, but also for teams such as Minerul Lupeni or Rapid București. Born in Petroșani, Tudorache spent almost all his career as a player at Jiul, but he was needed to retire at 30 years due to medical problems.Jiul 100. Fotbal, om la om (I) / Marin Tudorache: „Marii jucători ai Jiului s-ar răscoli în mormânt dacă ar vedea unde este acum echipa”. hunedoaraplus.ro After retirement he was dedicated as a manager for the same club. Tudorache was the manager of Jiul at all the levels, from Liga I to Liga IV and youth level. A part of Jiul, Tudorache managed Minerul Lupeni, Arieșul Turda and Energeticianul at the level of the second tier.Marin Tudorache, noul antrenor al Energeticianului. zvj.ro His son, Vlad Tudorache, is also a footballer.Vlad Tudorache dă replica pe teren, după ce a fost reprimit în lotul Energeticianului. „Fiule, drumul spre marea performanță nu este presărat cu petale de trandafiri”. liga2.prosport.ro ==Honours== ===Player=== ;Jiul Petroșani *Divizia B: Winner (2) 1988–89, 1995–96 ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:1968 births Category:Living people Category:People from Petroșani Category:Romanian footballers Category:Association football midfielders Category:Liga I players Category:Liga II players Category:CSM Jiul Petroșani players Category:CS Minerul Lupeni players Category:FC Rapid București players Category:Romanian football managers Category:CSM Jiul Petroșani managers Category:ACS Viitorul Târgu Jiu managers
title: Marin Tudorache
